results.title: Bird banding in Australia
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, CSIRO and Division of Wildlife Research
results.brief_description: Shows how the handling of birds helps biologists to collect information essential for the study and conservation of rare species and the control of pests. Some of the diverse methods banders use for trapping wild birds are shown.

results.title: Biologica (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM has been designed as a learning and reference tool. The content has beeen selected to fulfil the requirements of most senior high school and introductory university courses in biology. Using the most recent research from universities, it features textual as well as audio and video information to explain concepts and theories, it also includes electron micrographs containing highlighted sections of diagrams, a dictionary of all terms used in the text and hypertext linked information. Includes detail on cell structure, photosynthesis, absorption of nutrients, molecular biology, reproduction, genetics, evolution and more…

results.title: Biography of an atomic vet
results.creator_credit: Nick Mazzuco, Richard Schmiechen, Television Laboratory and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: A personal account of one man’s involvement in the above ground atomic tests that took place in the United States during the 1950’s. Nick Mazzucco recalls the growing awareness of the massive ignorance and indifference of the government in the acceptance of ‘safe radiation levels’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Mazzuco, Richard Schmiechen, Television Laboratory and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

results.title: Billion dollar bubble: the true story of the biggest fraud of all time (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Gibson, British Broadcasting Corporation, Horizon Films (AU) and Horizon (GB)
results.brief_description: A re-enactment of one of the biggest frauds of all time. In 1969, the Equity Funding Corporation of America lacked the facts to make an accurate profit forecast because of computer troubles. They made a guess - two million dollars too optimistic. So two young executives fed fictitious insurance polices in the computer - all prefixed “99” so that they could easily be cancelled when the temporary loan was paid off. But the temptation to escalate the fraud became irresistible. Cast includes James Woods, Bill Hootkins, Shane Rimmer, Sam Wanamaker, Christopher Guest and Lionel Murton. Script by Tom Clarke.

results.title: Billal
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Tom Zubrycki was intending to make a documentary film about unemployed youth in Sydney’s western suburbs when he came across the Etters, a Lebanese Muslim family who had migrated to Australia. What was initially meant to be a film exploring migration and class relationships in urban Australia became something else when the second son, Billal, was the victim of a racially motivated attack which left him brain damaged. As Zubrycki allows his camera to explore each individual family member’s response to the accident, the film becomes an exploration of grief and suffering, and a tribute to the young man’s attempt to adjust to his new situation. Billal and his family infuse their stories with humour and insight, and as the film explores Billal’s rehabilitation, it also becomes an absurd commentary on the under-resourced Australian public health system. “Billal” is then a documentary which is largely about family, and of how a family deals with the tragic consequences of violence. But it is also, of course, a documentary which with subtlety and piquancy, illuminates the destructive effects of racism.

results.title: Biko: Breaking the silence
results.brief_description: A political documentary shot in Zimbabwe and South Africa, this commemorates the 10th anniversary of Steve Biko’s death. It provides an insight into the complexities of the politics of the last decade, pivoting on the powerfully influential character of Biko. The film defines the aims of the Black Consciousness Movement of which Biko was an active and important leader, and explores its relevance from inception in the late 60s to the present day. It includes interviews with friends and medical and professional colleagues.

results.title: Bigger than Texas
results.creator_credit: Mark Pugh, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: During a bank hold-up the robber and one of his victims strike up an unlikely rapport. An ‘almost’ love story about the chance meeting of two misfits in search of escape routes from their sordid lives. The music and Pugh’s photography propel these intriguing characters through a world of surreal suspense.

results.title: Big town (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claudia Weill, Eliot Noyes, Michael Bortman and Cyclops Films
results.brief_description: Presents five vignettes about life in and around New York City. “Mannequin” - by Michael Bortman - preparation for a mannequin parade. “Marriage” - a city marriage; “Commuters” - early morning commuters; “Yoga” - a yoga group; “Lost and Found” - the little losses that loom large to the people of the big city - by Elliot Noyes, Jr and Claudia Weill.
